Metadata: Effect of nocturnal illumination of hatchery raceways on the smoltification-​associated lunar-phased thyroxine rise
"Proceedings of the 1990 Northeast Pacific Chinook and Coho Salmon Workshop," Thomas J. Hassler, ed.s, p. 237, Arcata, California, September 18-22, 1990.

The smoltification-​associated thyroid hormone (thyroxine) rise is considered a reliable indicator of readiness for seaward migration in coho salmon "Oncorhynchus kisutch". Timing of this thyroxine rise is lunar-phased; the major thyroxine peak is associated with the new moon nearest the vernal equinox in northern California. Preliminary results indicate that nocturnal illumination of hatchery raceways can interfere with the magnitude of thyroxine rise in the developing smolt.
